description.narrative: Improvement of Central Karakoram National Park (CKNP) Management System as Model for Mountain Ecosystems in Norther Pakistan

activity-description.narrative: Management and operational plan for CKNP and DNP formulized and implemented, livelihood options been provided to the people living in buffer zones

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
1.1: Extent to which CKNP and DNP Management and operational plans are ready for submission for approval [Scale: 1 = CKNP Management Plan is outdated and DNP Management Plan doesn't exist; 2 = CKNP and DNP Management Plans are being developed and updated; 3 = CKNP and DNP Management Plans are submitted for approval]
1.2: Extent to ecological corridor between CKNP and DNP is mapped and corridor management guidelines prepared [Scale: 1 = No ecological corridor/management guidelines exist; 2 = Assessment completed to establish ecological corridor; 3 = Ecological corridor between CKNP and DNP mapped and management guidelines prepared through consensus among major stakeholders]
1.3: Extent to which government institutions and communities have the skills and awareness in protected area management [Scale: 1 = capacity and awareness exists to a very limited extent; 2 = capacity and awareness exists to a very partial extent; 3 = capacity and awareness exists to some extent; 4 = capacity and awareness exists to a significant extent]
1.4: Number of people (men and women) benefitting from sustainable livelihood options (subsistence farming, livestock breeding, sustainable tourism etc) in view of climate change

comment.narrative: 1.1: 1 (CKNP management plan is outdated. DNP management plan do not exist) 1.2: 1 (No ecological corridor/management guidelines exists) 1.3: 1 (capacity and awareness exist to very limited extent) 1.4: 215,000 people

1.1: 1 [Management plan for 1 protected area other than National Parks prepared and submitted to GB Government.] 1.2: No target 1.3: 4 [Capacity and awareness exist to a significant extent] 1.4: 11950 people (in addition to the previous year results: total 281,223))

1.1: 1 [The Management and Operational Plans for Central Karakoram and Deosai National Parks presented to the Gilgit-Baltistan Wildlife Management Board for approval].
1.2: No Target for 2021
1.3: Scale 4 [Economic empowerment of communities was done through various livelihood opportunities through the project (tunnels, afforestation, solar drying units and fuel efficient stoves); Awareness raising on biodiversity conservation and protected areas management; A Knowledge center on glaciology established at the Karakoram International University in Gilgit; A Knowledge center and museum established at Deosai National Park in Baltistan. A region wide consultative process was conducted in GB region to consolidate the products of the project for integration and synergies. The consultations were made separately with local communities, departmental staff and academic organizations].
1.4: [285,332 in total]
- Approx. 285,332 (including 1175 women, 17825 youth, 250 poor, 27 disabled and 2180 marginalized for 2021 as direct beneficiaries) people benefiting from cultivation of climate resilient high value crops and fruit trees, multipurpose indigenous trees, better access to water resources through energy efficient water management systems, better quality water resource development for school children in remote areas, improvement in pasture management, water safety planning, better indoor environment and resource conservation through fuel efficient stoves, increased resilience to COVID and related hazards and increased capacity building in livelihood sectors. All these beneficiaries come from poor and middle income families where majority fall in the age group 25-45 years. At least 40% of these persons are female. Specifications of the activities include following: - Awareness sessions for 2025 students (including 780 female students) regarding covid, hygiene and diet held. - Awareness session held for 450 community members (including 197 women members) and porters and guides held. - more than 500 Personal hygiene kits distributed. - Two (2) Training events held at Skardu and Paju to train 200 porters, sardars, guides, and tour operators on the SOPs developed for the safe tourism. Clean up campaign was also held at the sites for cleaner environment and awareness raising. - The Tourism dependent community (Sardars, Tour Guides, Tour Operators, Porters, Cooks, and Drivers) were engaged in clean-up campaign to provide daily wages and clean the environment. - 97 water filtration and purification units were installed at school level benefiting 3384 students (including 1593 female students). - 08 number of solar drying units for mountain fruits installed and operationalized in rural areas, operated by women community. - 08 number of green house vegetable production units installed and operationalized in rural areas, operated by women community. - 08 number of solar powered water pumps installed and operationalized along the rivers to irrigate barren land for farming and household use, benefiting men and women communities of the area. - 50 number of fuel efficient stoves distributed among rural women in high altidue mountain areas for promoting healthy indoor environment and conservation of wood energy. - 02 number of eco-villages developed (in Hussainabad Skardu, and Bagrot Gilgit). The eco-villages provide facilities for environmental friendly tourism activities, zero waste generation, organic production and culture preservation and display museum. - 04 number of women entrepreneurship centers developed in 4 villages. The centers produce wool products, and natural products produced by local women groups. The products are being promoted through market linkages and value addition training. - Necessary medical support equipment provided to GB district administration and health department for effectively combating the risk of COVID-19 in GB area.

1.1: Scale 3 [CKNP and DNP Management Plans are submitted for approval]. 1.2: Scale 3 [Ecological corridor between CKNP and DNP mapped and management guidelines prepared through consensus among major stakeholders]. 1.3: Scale 4 [Capacity and awareness exists to a significant extent]. 1.4: 247,250 [Number of people (men and women) benefitting from sustainable livelihood options (subsistence farming, livestock breeding, sustainable tourism etc.) in view of climate change].

1.1: Scale 3 [1. CKNP and DNP Management and Operational Plans are updated and submitted to GB Government for approval. 2. Customary practices in DNP documented ., 3. Valley Conservation & Development Plans prepared for 5 valleys.] 1.2: Scale 3 [Ecological corridor between CKNP and DNP has been mapped, and management guidelines have been prepared in consultation with all stakeholders] 1.3 Scale 4 [Capacity and awareness exists to a significant extent]. 1.4: 269,273 [DETAILS OF BENEFICIARIES: - Fuel efficient stoves: 413 -Solar fruit drying units: 9082 - Efficient irrigation technologies: 7765 - Improved pasture planning: 8838 Off-season vegetables: 800 - Hydro rams water pumps: 210 -Solar water pumps: 6000 - Fruit plants: 16524 -Multipurpose trees: 6513 - climate resilient crops : 9852 - Veterinary services: 3000 - improved drinking water facilities: 6534]

1.1: Scale 3 [CKNP and DNP Management Plans are submitted for approval]. 1.2: Scale 3 [Ecological corridor between CKNP and DNP mapped and management guidelines prepared through consensus among major stakeholders]. 1.3: Scale 4 [Capacity and awareness exists to a significant extent]. 1.4: 247,250 [Number of people (men and women) benefitting from sustainable livelihood options (subsistence farming, livestock breeding, sustainable tourism etc.) in view of climate change].

1.1: Scale 3 [Draft Management Plans for CKNP and DNP are ready. However, the same will be submitted for approval after conducting consultative process next quarter]. 1.2: Scale 3 [Ecological corridor between CKNP and DNP has been mapped and draft management guidelines have been prepared]. 1.3: Scale 4 [Capacities of staff, communities and youth have been built through following ways: - formal training sessions for staff of CKNP and DNP on management planning of protected areas - exposure visit for staff to international best practices in protected areas management - formal training for communities in agriculture, livestock, ecotourism and other livelihood activities -awarenes raising through International Mountain Day, World Tourism Day, National workshop on MPA -Organizing summer camps for school children (male and female) - Engagement of students and interns]. 1.4: 13,510 [The following number of people have been benefiting from sustainable livelihood options: - Off-season vegetables: 800 - Hydro rams: 160 -Solar water pumps: 6000 - Fruit plants: 200 -Multipurpose trees: 350 - climate resilirebnt crops : 500 - Veternery sertvices: 3000 - improved drinking water facilitieas: 2500].
